name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a Hilton Honors Gold VIP member I have stayed at quite a few Hilton properties: Paris CDG, Paris La Defence, Budapest Castle, Orlando, Toronto etc etc
reviews.title: One of the Best Hilton Hotel's I have stayed at!

reviews.text: However if you like modern buildings with cutting edge rooms, this hotel ranks above them all.
reviews.title: Very good, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent rooms, with lovely decor and facilities.
reviews.title: Superb city hotel

likes.liked: — Everything is brand new and of the highest standard
likes.disliked: — Nothing - Hilton has done a great job here

reviews.text: The gym is very good for a hotel gym (although can be busy).
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, amazing mood
Fantastic!
reviews.text: Breakfast is excellent - one of the best I have had.

reviews.title: Excellent in almost every way
reviews.text: The Hilton hotel has a few major advantages over other hotels I have stayed in this great tourist city:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) It is right outside the central station which happens to be a few stations closer to the airport than most other hotels. (When arriving drained by a long distance flight even a 20 minute shorter train ride is a bonus)
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: 2) Beautiful rooms with huge plasma televisions and great undisturbed views.
reviews.title: Great Value for $100

likes.liked: — Location next to train station, tv, and bathroom

reviews.text: 3) Impressive variety of restaurants. As it shares an entrance with the Meridien hotel next door you literally have over a dozen world class restaurants to choose from. You can also charge a meal at the Meridien to your hilton room which is convinient.
reviews.title: Superb value for money

reviews.text: The downside, however, is that the rooms have heavy wooden doors and whenever a neighbouring door shuts you cant avoid hearing it even when tucked in bed. This is a problem with the door design due to the noisy door handles so if you are "soft" sleeper you may need to reconsider staying here.
reviews.title: The best hotel I've ever stayed in

reviews.text: Really the best hotel I have ever been. Olny one complain,Internet price was really expensive
reviews.title: Simply Perfect

reviews.text: If you go to KL thats the hotel.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel, lovely rooms and scenes. Best hilton i stayed with being a gold VIP we got upgraded. would def recommend this hotel at night we didnt even bother leaving the hotel we chilled out in the masive lobby or heading to the hotel club.
reviews.title: KL Favourite

likes.disliked: — Cocktails hour in club lounge too short :-)

reviews.text: Just outside the main railway station very convenient for the airport. Rooms where cheap would def stay there. You will need a cab ride to almost all destinatons however taxis are DEAD CHEAP
reviews.title: Absolutely great

likes.disliked: — not central located but travel easy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for second time in December while on business- first time was while on holidays earlier in the year. Centrally located next to central railway- door to door service in about 30 min by the airport express train. Rooms are ultra modern, comfortable and well kitted out- although need to spend the first few minutes finding some of the hidden ammenities (NB. the ironing board is hidden behind a what first appears to be a wall panel and there is an electrical adapter plug in the ammenities kit in the bathroom!) . Fantastic gym but the pool tended to be a bit crowded during our stays. As the room rates are so reasonable recommend spending a little extra for the club floor to take advantage of the great breakfasts and evening cocktails which are included in the rate. And another tip- book early- it was overbooked on an earlier visit and I had to stay at the shack down the road.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband on a stopover to Auz. The only thing that I can say is that it was wonderful from the moment that we were met at the station and guided to a car to take us and our luggage to the door until the moment that we left. I was a bit worried that the position of the hotel would be a problem but with the rail station just on its doorstep it never was. We had the best Chinese meal ever in the resturant and the breakfasts were to die for. We can't wait to return and would stay for longer next time I cannot recommend this hotel enough.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for a business meeting. I really love this place!! Simply put, it was awesome! The room was hi-tech, spacious, super-clean, nice smell! It was equipped with a plasma TV (i wasn't sure what size it was, but it was huge!) and there was also a small TV screen in the bathroom! The bath tub was huge too, equipped with candles. The also gave u nice bedroom slippers, a nice rob. So perfect for total relaxation! The breakfast was excellent! I juz couldnt stop eating! Stay here if u want value for money in terms of service and hospitality, but if u are into outdoors and beach activities this is not a place for u cos it's located in the heart of the city and the view was juz average. I am so thankful to my employer for paying RM450 for me to stay here!
reviews.title: This is the place to stay if u r wiling to pay more!

reviews.text: I stayed at the KL Hilton for 2 weeks in August 06. I stayed on the Executive Floor and the room was very nice. Flat screen TV, Marble Bathroom, Over-head Rain shower. The hotel staff was very friendly. The room was cleaned promptly each day (Though the scent they used in the room was a bit overpowering). Room service was prompt and the food was top notch. The "Magic" button is a godsend whenever you have a random question.
reviews.title: 1st Class Luxury

likes.disliked: — Scent used for cleaning the rooms.

reviews.text: The concierge in the lobby was VERY helpful for tours and other arrangements. For cabs, I would suggest not taking the YellowCabs that come to the hotel door. They are a bit overpriced for the area. Instead, head across the street and either take the Train, or take one of the cabs at the train station. They are not as nice, but the fare is about 1/4 the cost of the Yellow Cabs. One warning on this though, many of those cab driver DO NOT speak english very well. So if you are not fluent in Malay, then you may have difficulty communicating where you need to go.
reviews.title: Fab hotel with beautiful suites

likes.liked: — This is an elegant, beautifully appointed hotel
likes.disliked: — Use the Monorail for travel to town. And check in for your flight home at KL Sentral

reviews.title: Excellent location, nice decor!
reviews.text: Overall, I'd say this is in my top 5 for hotels I have had the pleasure of staying in. And for the cost (Roughly $120 per night US), it can't be beat.

description: In 2013, Hilton Kuala Lumpur won Asia’s Leading City Spa Hotel accorded by World Travel Awards and Best City Hotel in Kuala Lumpur from TTG Asia. Expatriate Lifestyle's 'Best of Malaysia' also rated Hilton Kuala Lumpur in similar category for Best Business Hotel.Hilton Kuala Lumpur is only 28 minutes away by direct train from Kuala Lumpur International Airport.With modern and innovative design, the 35-storey building houses 503 guestrooms equipped with 42" plasma TVs, rain showers and high-speed wifi access. Executive Rooms and Suites offer Executive Lounge access.Our hotel has received the 2013 TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence Award. This honor is awarded to establishments that achieve outstanding traveler reviews on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site. Our staff takes great pride in consistently offering an exceptional experience to our guests.
